description:
Have you ever dreamed of a place made entirely of delicious treats? Now you can realize that dream by becoming a city planner for the beautiful and tasty, Sweetlandia!

Use Bidding Cards to acquire building areas from a delectable collection of locations: Gumdrop Garden, Rocky Road, Marshmallow Mountain, Lemonade Lake, Candy Cornfields, and many others. Choose the right locations to achieve your goals and earn the most Donuts from Mayor McSweet. Make good choices, and watch Sweetlandia grow!

It's fun. It's unpredictable. It's...sweet! And you don't need a sweet tooth to win!

—description from the publisher

Design by Committee is a competitive/cooperative game of product development. Every player will work to achieve both their own, individual Requirements as well as the Requirements of the product as a whole.

Gameplay advances over the course of multiple games. You earn or lose points each game depending on the outcome of the product and your overall success in simultaneously achieving your own personal goals. The first player to earn 50 or more total points (as an ongoing score across multiple games) is the winner. There is no minimum score, players can freely go into negative numbers.

—description from the designer

Discover Germany by playing, what can be done faster? First visit Winnetou in Bad Segeberg and then visit the largest wine barrel in the world in Heidelberg? Or first to the cathedral in Cologne? The players from Deutschlandreise go on an exciting and informative journey across Germany. The goal: Visit eight cities and be the first to return to the pre-determined starting point. The players plan an ideal travel route for this. You can expect over two hundred sights such as the Brandenburg Gate or interesting towns such as Rothenburg ob der Tauber. These are presented to you in words and pictures. With interesting action cards your own journey can be accelerated or that of the other players slowed down! With good planning, a bit of luck with the dice and the clever use of your action cards, you will be the first to end the exciting journey through Germany.

Players race puppies through a Pacific Northwest inspired whimsical gameboard.

In this D6 roll-to-move, players weigh tradeoffs between pausing to pick up more resource cards and pushing through, racing to reach home first. Cards allow additional movement or setting rivals back on the path, at limited opportunities. Cards and special board spaces involve the players performing simple no-stakes in-the-real-world physical (e.g., hop like a frog) and mental (e.g., answer a question or spell a word) activities.

The American Professional Football Game, 1920-1949, is a print-and-play solitaire educational board game that teaches you the history of professional football from the inception of the American Professional Football Association in 1920 through the National Football League’s 1949 gridiron season.

Your goal is to help professional football survive and thrive by spending Moxie points and attempting to activate inactive teams, stabilize unstable teams, hire and move players and other contributors to teams, lobby for new stadiums, and scout out new independent professional teams. You must also play exhibition games to help those independent professional teams earn the Bona Fide status and to earn more Moxie points.

—description from the designer

A family strategy game accessible to all: those who already love the world of Alix and those who are discovering it!

         From 2 to 3 players individually,
          From 4 to 6 players in a team.
    



     Set off on a race through the Roman Empire to visit the cities to which Rome sends you on missions.
     Stop off in the great cities of the ancient world and be the first to return to Rome once your missions are completed
     Use strategy and beware of your opponents or the twists of fate. 


May the gods be with you!
Order-Up: Burger Edition is a fast, fun, burger-matching card game that is perfect for the whole family. Race against your fellow cooks to complete five orders, but don't forget to yell "Order-Up!"

A dice action game in a wooden box with a felt carpet in it. Target of the game is to get as much point after 12 rounds by throwing dices in the wooden box to manipulate own dices and dices of all other players.

There are special rules for single player game or 2 player game, too.

—user summary

Marine may have gathered her sailors and put herself back together again, but now Space Marine appears from another dimension. The journey to collect characters from Azur Lane, Touhou Project, and hololive begins anew.

Play sailors from your hand to gain Vtuber Points (VP) in order to purchase more powerful sailors from the market and improve your deck. This time around, many abilities focus on removing cards from your deck as the game goes on in order to perform more powerful actions and get extra VP. The game ends at the end of the round when a player reaches 20 or more VP. Whoever has the most VP is the winner.

Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players. You need to provide four D6 dices.
It's a simple game with a math mechanic. The Players will do manipulations with dices and try to catch the opponent when he can’t do his move. On the player's turn, he can change the dice value downside or place another dice. But be careful, each field have a special number, so you can’t change a value lower than this number. A player who can't do his turn loses this game. 
KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)

Ale Pary: Misz Masz features gameplay identical to that of Spot it! 1,2,3, with the game consisting of 31 cards, each showing six images. Any two cards have exactly one image in common, and your challenge when playing is to spot what that matching image is before anyone else.

Junior Colourbrain is a colourful quiz for kids where they get all the answers before they start, and they’re all colours!

All the questions are based on things kids should know but adults might struggle with, such as, “What colour are Strawberry Millions?”

Using the 11 Colour Cards in your hand, players put down the correct colour (or colours) to win the card. If it’s a draw, it starts a rollover! Play the correct colours and your team can race ahead with the points... as long as some of the other teams get it wrong. First to reach 10 points, wins!

The Salamanders of Beauvais is a trivia-goose game that lets you discover the city of Beauvais in northern France. 
As in the goose game there is chance, a maze, traps, a prison... 
but also, as in Trivial Pursuit, questions, 330 that allow players to progress in the game on sport, history, cinema ... 
It contains 62 boxes illustrated with old photos of the streets and monuments of Beauvais or of its outstanding personalities.

However, you can count on the help of the magic Salamander to progress in the game...

At the outer reaches of London's most sought-after postcode sits Emerald Hill, the city's highly exclusive gated community. When Mr. Addington, the snobbish owner of the estate, is found dead on the marble floor of his en suite bathroom, it's clear that his death was no accident. Each of the residents, from Tiffany the VHS fitness queen to Keith the daytime soap heartthrob, is hiding an explosive secret, but only one of them would go so far as to kill in order to protect that secret!

Set in the 80s, when hair was big and shoulder pads were bigger, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives for the evening. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

ç®±åº­ã‚­ãƒ³ã‚°ã‚¹ (Hakinowa Kings) is a game from Japan themed around the seasons, with cards representing people from kingdoms that identify with Spring, Summer, Fall, and Winter. Players use cards like workers in a worker placement game. An opening card draft allows you to build a winning strategy from the very beginning.

Players compete to accumulate 15 resource points or construct 3 buildings to win. All players begin with the same 4 unbuilt buildings and 6 drafted cards. Buildings not only lead to a possible victory, they also provide helpful bonuses as long as they remain complete. Each turn progresses through 4 phases: the Seasonal Phase, Construction Phase, Action Phase, and End Phase.

In the Seasonal Phase, players take different actions depending on the season marked on the Season Board. In Spring, players gain a free card. In Summer, players can build for free. In Fall, players gain free resource points. And in Winter, players reduce the resource points or hurt the buildings of unprotected players.

In the Construction Phase, buildings that are partially built will progress on their own. Players may also spend a resource point to help one building along. In the Action Phase, players will play Action Cards. Some cards can only be played in certain seasons or when players have completed certain buildings. If no player has reached a victory condition in the End Phase, players continue with the next season.

Choose your cards wisely as you decide your path to victory!

user summary

Rob banks like Jesse James...enforce the law like Wyatt Earp...or maybe find something in between. If they did it, so can you with Six Gun Sound. With over 15 unique "professions" Six Gun Sound lets you experience the Wild West to the fullest.

Six Gun Sound is a fast paced set of "cowboy" rules that allows you to refight history or make your own. Whether you choose to fight a "one up" battle or string together a series of adventures, Six Gun Sound can do it all. Six Gun Sound is easy to learn yet entertaining for both veteran and novice players.

Set in the Old West from 1876-85 Six Gun Sound covers the Lincoln County War, the unpleasantness in Tombstone, the "Demise of the James Younger Gang," and the Great Sioux War of 76 as well as the founding of Deadwood and the death of Bill Hickok. And did we mention Apaches?

Six Gun Sound allows you to either fight unrelated gunfights or link them all together with a seamless and easy to use Campaign System. Watch your characters grow as they advance in skill making their way through the Old West. Bank robberies, cattle rustling, jail breaks, range wars, and more are at your finger tips with Six Gun Sound.

Six Gun Sound works with ANY figures you may already have and in any scale! Play solo, play on the same side, or play head-to-head -- it's your choice. So pop in your favorite Western movie and saddle up for adventure. And remember --- JUST PLAY THE GAME!

This fun game is your chance to show off your love for all things Friends The Television Series, and how well you can bring to life what is on the card before the time runs out.
Everything you need is supplied for you and your friends to play this fast-paced fun game. Includes a sand timer, 2x pencils, a pad of paper and 50x question cards. Draw and guess what's written on the cards. 
Why not gather your friends and family at your next game night or party and bring out the Friends Draw It game. Supplied in a closed printed box for easy storage and also makes a great gift for fans of this iconic comedy series.

—description from the publisher

Welcome young peasant! Towers & Turrets is a strategic tower-building card game that allows you to compete against other players to build the tallest, purest, and coolest towers your kitchen table has ever seen. But be careful young peasant. Other players are out to get you!

In this 2-5 players game you strategically build and defend your towers while attacking those of other players. Points are scored by completing towers. The taller the tower and the more pure the building materials the higher points gained. Be the first to 100 points to win.

—description from the publisher

At Chef Sweeter’s bakery, everybody is working at full speed! We have to make huge and delicious cakes. Who will be the fastest baker? Will you be able to make the highest cake?
The object of the game is to make the highest cake (10 layers) according to the orders you receive, keeping in mind that balance plays an important role.

Players place their Plates on their hands. On top of these Plates, they will stack the layers of their cakes depending on the Order card (one layer, two layers…). In order to do so, each player draws 2 Sponge Cake cards and places them in a way they can put a Frosting card on top of the Sponge cake. In following turns, they will stack layers on top of the ones that are already on their Plates.

The game ends when at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled:
•    A player makes a 10 layer cake, without it collapsing, and rings the bell.
•    The Order deck runs out of cards. In that case, players tally their points. The player with the most points wins the game (Order cards grant points according to their difficulty).
In case of a tie, the tied players share the victory.
Remember! There are 2 strategies to get the victory:
•    Stack the layers very quickly, with a high risk that your cake will collapse,
•    Or make the cake slowly in order to get the 10 layers.

La pastelería del Chef Sweeter está a todo gas. Debemos elaborar grandes y deliciosas tartas. ¿Qué pasteleros serán los más rápidos? ¿Serás capaz de elaborar la tarta más alta?
El objetivo del juego es construir la tarta más alta (10 pisos) según los pedidos que vayan surgiendo, teniendo en cuenta que el equilibrio juega un papel fundamental.

Los jugadores colocarán una bandeja en su mano y, sobre ella, construirán los pisos de la tarta en función de lo que mande la carta de pedido (un piso, dos pisos,…). Para ello, toman dos cartas plegadas de bizcocho, y las colocan de tal forma que puedan poner sobre ellas una carta redonda de cobertura. En turnos posteriores, construirán pisos sobre los que ya tuvieran en su bandeja.

El juego termina cuando se cumpla, al menos, una de estas condiciones:
• Un jugador elabore una tarta de 10 pisos sin que se caiga y pulse el timbre.
• Se terminen todas las cartas de pedido. En este caso, se cuentan los puntos conseguidos por cada jugador y gana quien más puntos haya obtenido. (Las cartas de pedido tienen puntos según su dificultad).
En caso de empate, se comparte la victoria. Recuerda que existen 2 estrategias para conseguir la victoria:
• Elaborando pisos de la tarta rápidamente, con mucho riesgo de que se caiga, o
• construyendo la tarta despacio con el fin de llegar a 10 pisos.

The game comes with a deck of fifty cards, each containing one Christmas-themed question, and an instruction sheet. In turn, each player is asked the question on the top card of the deck. A player keeps the card for scoring purposes when giving the correct response to the question. Cards answered incorrectly go to the bottom of the deck. The first player to score five correct answers is the winner.

Pâtée Impériale is a game of strategy cards, combinations and memory to be played individually or in teams of two.

Form the best suite of courtiers in order to obtain the most prestige points and get noticed by the emperor.

Each player starts with an equal number of cards in hand. Players take turns choosing a card and performing the described action.

At the end of 3 rounds, you should have accumulated the most prestige points than your opponents to win the game.

Be the first to position your 3 pieces on the 3 tiles that display the icon of your color.  16 tiles.

Players launch their pyramids from an edge base, can move 1, or can move in the direction of an arrow on a tile.  You may also be able to push another player's piece.

"Escape to Nowhere: Army Group South, December 1943- April 1944" uses 16-mile hexes and army and corps units-of-maneuver to cover the liberation of the Ukraine and the Crimea by the Red Army at that time.

Designed by Ty Bomba using the same alternating-actions system as the earlier game "Codeword Thunderclap: Army Group Don, November 1942 – March 1943".

Published in Command Magazine Japan #156. December 2020.

Imagine traveling around the galaxy with The Child, or affectionately known as "Baby Yoda" by fans. This Monopoly: Star Wars The Child edition board game features themes and artwork inspired by The Mandalorian live-action TV series on Disney Plus. Move around the gameboard as The Child, buy and sell Hideouts and Common Houses, and follow the actions on the Camtono cards and Bounty Puck cards. The last player remaining after everyone else has gone bankrupt wins the game!

This is a solo game of determination against increasingly demanding odds. You will attempt to ascend Mount Everest by rolling and manipulating dice to try and beat increasingly challenging scores. Playing the game is easy - succeeding is not.

All you need to play is a copy of the game sheet, pen/pencil and six D6. Game time will be around 15 minutes.

In June 1924, George Mallory and Andrew Irvine began their ascent to the peak of Mount Everest, hoping to be first to ever do so. It was to be a journey from which neither man would return alive, and whether or not they were successful remains a mystery to this day. When asked why he was planning to undertake such a dangerous and gruelling endeavour Mallory had replied simply “because it’s there”.

“We arrived at Mokpalin, from the south…There were masses of troops but no staffs… We were at the south of the railway station but west of the line, and throughout the day the Japs were attacking on the other side of the line… After a bit the Kawkareik Brigadier turned up… and really did get things organized. We were very glad to see him. We were to form a box round Mokpalin, we being in the S.W. corner.” –Officer of the 8th Burma Rifles about the battle for the Sittang Bridge.

The situation for the Allies in Burma was increasingly desperate following the Japanese invasion that began in December 1941. After nearly a month of fighting the British Dominion forces were in full retreat, hoping to meet with reinforcements being rushed to the theater and to regroup behind the Sittang River. Key to this goal was the successful withdrawal of the Indian 17th Division. That division had been engaged in a running fight with the Japanese 33rd (214th and 215th Regiments) and 55th (143rd Regiment) Divisions from the outset of the invasion. Both sides converged on the only major bridge over the Sittang river north of Rangoon, a railway span near the town of Sittang.  An Allied success here could potentially thwart the Japanese offensive and save Rangoon. Another victory for the Japanese could lead to the capture of that major port and even more conquests by the sons from the land of the Rising Sun.

Each copy of An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
One sheet of 70 double-sided, unmounted counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry units are battalions, all other units are companies. A hex is approximately 800 yards across. Each turn represents six hours of time. Players will need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is also available.

An Unpleasant and Devastating Fight is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

-description from designer

Domesday is a board game that adapts the COIN Series developed by GMT Games to the Norman Conquest of England. Players control the Norman, Saxon, Viking, and Scots/Welsh Factions and use Events, Commands and Special Abilities to place and move leaders and pieces on the map to control areas, gain support, and win victory.

Edward the Confessor returned from exile in Normandy after decades of Viking rule in 1042 to become king of England. Magnus the Good of Norway also claimed the throne, and threatened war, but was dissuaded by the childless Edward, who promised to make him his heir. Edward gave the same promise to Sweyn Estridsson of Denmark, William of Normandy, and Harold Godwinson. When he died in 1066 four powerful warlords claimed to be his rightful heir. It would not end well.

Cards are drawn from the deck one at time, with one card in play and the following card face up on top of the deck. Each Event card shows the order in which Eligible Factions may choose to resolve the Event or one of their own Commands, sometimes with one of their Special Abilities. Resolving an Event or Command makes the Faction Ineligible for the next card. Crown Events interrupt play as a King is crowned, Victory is determined, Revenue is collected, and Support is expanded.

-description from designer

"You and the other players are floral designers, and the most popular bouquets this season incorporate a wide variety of flowers. In this game, each value on a die represents a different flower... and only the most diverse arrangements will sell for top dollar!"

This is a dice rolling game where you are locking in values, deciding if you will stop & score the locked values or continue to pushing your luck and re-roll. You bust and score nothing if you only roll locked values on the next roll. If you stopped and scored you get points; the game ends when you get to 100 points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"You and the other players are little fish, trying to avoid the fisherman! At the end of the round, the biggest fish get caught, and only the little fish survive. Compete in secret for the highest score, but when your results are revealed each round, the best dice on the table get tossed out."

Secretively roll your dice up to three times and try and get the most points scored with any dice not caught. The highest number on the table is caught and doesn't score.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"You and your opponent are reluctant partners. Work alongside your enemy to determine the winning condition, then try to take them out!"

In this 2 player game you secretly choose a die from those that you rolled to contribute to the center. These set your winning conditions to trying to beat this pot's value with your remaining dice, equaling the value, or being lower. If you can meet the conditions you win the round! Win 5 rounds and you in the game...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"You and other players are all doctors of questionable skills and ethics. Score points when your patients survive, and when they don't. Will you be a hero, a monster, or both?"

You have two dice patients you are caring for... Roll their values and you can improve their health. Doubles and triples allow even more health improvement. Those you can't tend to have their health erode. If the patient die rises above six the patient scores for you and a new patient die comes in. If a die's health erodes below 1, they die and likewise get replaced.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"'Everything in the universe relates to five, one way or another, given enough ingenuity on the part of the interpreter.'

- The Law of Fives, Principia Discordia"

This is played in rounds where rolling matching triples on 5 dice score points along with other matching numbers. Each player takes a turn within the round rolling and scoring. Whenever 50 points is reached the round is finished so everyone gets an equal turn and the player with the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"In this cooperative game, you and other players take on classic adventurer roles and charge deep into the monster's lair. Kill enough monsters and become legendary heroes! Fail too often and you become a cautionary tale..."

Each player has six dice while the rest are the dice pool representing the monster. Low valued dice are not a part of the monster. Players decide and declare what role they will be - bard, wizard, warrior, etc. Then they roll their dice. They then  remove monster dice if they can match the dice per their role's abilities. If they defeat the monster (i.e. the monster has no more dice), the group earns a point. If there are dice remaining though, the monster deals one point damage per die remaining. If the group can get 5 points before they get 5 damage points, they win. If neither of these have been hit, take another round. If the party ever gets 5 points of damage though - well, the tales told in the taverns won't be happy ones...

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

Join Marvel Heroes as they battle a battery of bad guys bent on taking over the world!
If you're game, then Marvel Heroes Power Play Electronic Game Book is for you! Inside, you'll find five exciting board games that put you right in the middle of the action and make you a member of the Marvel Heroes team. Just pick your Super Hero play pieces and get ready to help Spider-Man, the Fantastic Four, X-men, Avengers, and the Hulk defeat their foes.

—description from the publisher

"You are captain of a well armed ship, caught in a broadside battle against an enemy vessel captained by your opponent. As you race forward, you fire at the other ship and bark orders at your crew!"

Each round you will secretly rearrange your weakest and strongest areas amongst 3 different zones of your ship. Then you will declare what part of your opponent's ship you are targeting and roll dice. Did you get a hit? They adjust the amount of damage downwards. Did you miss entirely, then you adjust downwards. If a section of a ship goes below 1, then the ship sinks.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"Blast the most targets in this silly dexterity game and win!"

This is a dice flicking game aimed at collecting cards. Whoever claims the most cards when the draw deck runs out, wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"In this dice-based twist on a classic dominoes game, players use pairs of dice to create a long train. Get stuck with dice at the end, however, and your game will derail quickly!"

You have a dice 'bone pile' that you play from adding to the dealer's lead pair, treating the dice pair as a domino. Each person in turn tries to connect a pair or pass, when everyone passes the round is over and remaining dice score against you. Once someone gets to 10 points the winner is determined.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"Maintain a careful balance as you chase three high scores at once!"

This one is a bit of a math at the end where you are trying to optimize the summed difference of scores to be the closest to 50 across three scoring columns. Each person is working to do this.

The game can be played in turns or simultaneous.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

Bluey is a loveable, six-year-old Blue Heeler dog, who loves to turn everyday family life into endless, playful adventures. She loves to create and play unique games with her family and friends. Play a game of "Shadowlands" with Bluey and her friends. Stay in the shadowy bits, collect 5 Cupcake Cards and be the first to the picnic! Turn the palm tree in the center of the board to change the shadowy bits as you play! This fun and unpredictable board game is great for children aged 3 and up!

—description from the publisher

Father Vergara is an exorcist, boxer and ex convict, who has been exiled by the Vatican to a remote village of Spain. This tranquil little village does not know what has hit it when it begins to experience a series of inexplicable paranormal phenomena, and it won’t take long for the villagers to realise the new parish priest is somehow involved. Paco, the naive Mayor and Elena, a restless vet, will try to unveil the secrets of the priest’s past and the significance of the old coin that Vergara has in his possession. Little by little, this unusual trio will find themselves immersed in a global conspiracy: the battle for control of the thirty coins paid to the apostle Judas Iscariot for betraying Jesus Christ.

In 30 Coins you will put yourself in the shoes of the three main characters, Father Vergara, the Mayor Paco and the veterinary surgeon Elena. You will need to investigate the paranormal events which are occurring in the village, confront another world and try to sabotage the plans devised by the forces of evil. You will achieve your goal if you complete the missions which are presented to you at the beginning of each chapter and at the same time you must avoid The Cainites getting hold of the Coin you possess. Should you fail and they manage to get their hands on the last Coin of Judas, the consequences will be devastating for all humanity.


El padre Vergara, un exorcista, boxeador y exconvicto, es exiliado por el Vaticano a un pueblo remoto de España. La tranquilidad de esta Villa se verá alterada por una serie de fenómenos paranormales y hechos sin explicación que pronto se relacionarán con el nuevo párroco. Paco, el ingenuo alcalde y Elena, una inquieta veterinaria, tratarán de desvelar los secretos del pasado del cura y el significado de la antigua moneda que Vergara mantiene oculta. Poco a poco, este insólito trío de héroes se encontrará inmerso en una conspiración global: la batalla por el control de las treinta monedas por las que el apóstol Judas lscariote traicionó a Jesús de Nazaret.

En 30 Monedas te pondrás en la piel de los tres personajes principales de la trama, el Padre Vergara, el Alcalde Paco y la veterinaria Elena. Deberás investigar los sucesos paranormales que se suceden en el pueblo, enfrentarse a seres de otro mundo e intentar sabotear los planes de las fuerzas del mal. Lograrás tu objetivo si completas las misiones que irán apareciendo al principio de cada capítulo al mismo tiempo que evitas que los Cainitas se hagan con la Moneda que custodias, ya que si consiguen hacerse con la última Moneda de Judas, las consecuencias serán devastadoras para la humanidad.

"You and the other players are competing to contract cargo ships which will bring valuable goods to port. Staying out at sea too long is risky, as weather can endanger your entire fleet. Will you gamble on long voyages for big money, or will you play it safe and stay close to home?"

Shipping lanes are made up of 7 cards 1-6 and another for scoring. You roll dice not at sea and can choose pairs to go to sea or not. One die chooses where to start and the other is the value of the cargo.

Then you roll two dice to see if a storm shows up and whether you lose any of your ships. Ships lost are removed and can be rerolled again next turn.

Finally move your ships forward (towards the lower number), if any move to zero and onto the scoring card earning points through a multiplication; doubles can net you a couple of bonus points.

If anyone reaches the 100 point goal or more the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

The Monopoly Bid game is a game of chance, luck, and strategy as players bid in blind auctions, pay with money cards, steal properties with Action cards, and change their luck with Wild cards. Played in rounds, everyone gets a chance to host an auction. When it's time to bid on a property, players choose how much money they want to risk. Then everyone shouts, "1, 2, 3, Bid!" and lays their money cards down. The player who bid the most money gets that property. Collect 3 property sets to win.

—description from the publisher's website

Páros Játszma is a board game that raises serious and funny questions between couples living and in love together that they think they know about each other. 
The board game reveals whether we know each other well.

Sure, it raises conflicts in several cases, but that makes it an interesting game. 
Dormant desires, dreams, or even annoying little things can come up. Get to know yourself wisely!

Couple vs couple game mode:
This board game is actually a dating quiz where it can even turn out that friends know the couple better than they know each other.
Going through the fields of the board, you will encounter many good-natured, provocative, or surprising questions, if you know your partner’s answer in advance because you know him/her well, you can move quickly to victory!

The pirate gang has collect huge piles of loot, and to distribute the treasures, they've decided to play the legendary pirate skittles game.

Who will manage to make the ball roll skillfully down the launch tube in Käpt'n Kuller to hit the desired diamonds and in the end collect the most gold coins?

"You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you're all a bit lazy and really don't feel like working too hard."

Interesting game in that if the team does well, the players that did the most work earn the least points, but if the team did poorly, then those that pulled more than their weight do get the most points.

The game plays in rounds until the target score is reached; this is calculated based on the number of players. Each player gets 4 dice per player contributing one to the monster pool in the center. Roll the monster dice and that is what you the total you need to beat the monster. Roll your 3 remaining dice and secretly choose some number of those to defeat the monster.

Then you will score based on success or failure relative to where you fall your the contribution. Once one player gets to the target the game ends with the highest score the winner.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!"

This game is played in rounds and you want to gain 6s per round to score points, but you need to be able to get those and 1s to keep rolling. Keep pushing your luck trying not to bust to improve your score.

When someone breaks 50 points or higher at the end of a round the game ends and the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

"In this tense game of give and take, you must know when to attack and when to guard. Boost your own score or steal from your opponent? Only one you is left standing in the end!"

This is a game of taking turns swapping locked dice to try and achieve the highest sum. It's actually clever in that it uses both a single die and your opponent's rolled dice as potential locking mechanisms.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

The Danish version of Monopoly is a game called Matador which was first published by C. Drechsler Papirvarefabrik in 1936. C. Drechsler died at the end of the second world war and the company was sold to the Swedish company Brio in the beginning of the 1970s.

The streets in the game are popular streets of Copenhagen, the capital of Denmark. Along with the usual Monopoly items, it features a circular track.

The Icelandic edition is the first edition of Monopoly published in Iceland, prior to 1964, named Matador. The streets of that version are located in downtown Reykjavík, and companies include Loftleiðir and Flugfélag Íslands.

Trivia: When the Swedish publisher Alga lost the rights to publish Monopoly in the Nordic countries in 1981, they briefly considered designing their own Monopoly clone in order to fill the vacuum, called Monetär. Concept drawings of that game look very much like Matador, with a circular track.

Vampire Hunter is a single deck card game where players try to become the best Vampire Hunter by killing undead blood suckers and collecting their fangs. The first player to collect fifteen fangs is the winner. That said a player can also win by being the last player left. This is a game for two to four players.

On their turn, a player must take one of three actions. Either visiting the city to equip themselves with weapons and other items, attacking one of the colorful yet horrifying enemies lurking within the city, or using and equipped item. If you are unable to take any action, you must discard one of your precious items card and take a damage.

Variable deck set-up and character selection (each with a unique ability) means no two games will play exactly the same.
